main event: A bright, shiny silver object was observed over Morton, Illinois on January 4, 1960 for approximately 15-20 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be very bright and of a brilliant, shiny silver color.
The object moved at a terrific rate of speed and appeared to hover at times.
The observation was made at 0330 when Mars was high in the sky to the northeast.
The report was received by the United States Air Force on January 7, 1960.
The report was forwarded to the eyewitness for their information, and they were asked to provide any comprehensive reports concerning flying objects.
